keyTakeAways: Tzachi Hanegbi, Israel’s former national security adviser, has been dismissed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, amid growing tensions over policy differences during the war on Gaza.
Hanegbi stated he shares responsibility for the failures that led to the October 7 Hamas attack and called for a thorough investigation.
Gil Reich, the deputy head of the National Security Council, has been appointed as acting head of the NSC following Hanegbi’s departure.
The firing has sparked criticism from opposition figures like Gadi Eisenkot, who accuse Netanyahu’s government of evading responsibility and replacing dissenting voices with loyalists.

The dismissal highlights deep divisions within Israel’s leadership over the war strategy in Gaza, particularly regarding whether to pursue a full military takeover or a negotiated partial deal with Hamas.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dismissed Tzachi Hanegbi, the national security adviser, citing growing tensions over Israel’s Gaza war strategy, particularly Hanegbi’s opposition to a full military takeover of Gaza City and his support for a partial deal with Hamas. Hanegbi acknowledged shared responsibility for the failures that led to the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack and called for a thorough investigation, which has not yet been established by the government. In response, Netanyahu appointed Gil Reich, deputy head of the National Security Council, as acting head. The move has drawn sharp criticism from opposition figures like Gadi Eisenkot, who accuse the government of evading accountability and replacing dissenting voices with loyalists, underscoring deep political divisions over national security policy and responsibility for past failures.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu fires national security chief amid Gaza tensions
